author: anetabtc
title: anetaBTC on Cardano and Ergo
description: We must have a protocol that unlocks the value of Bitcoin on Cardano to fully optimize Cardano DeFi potential.

f6_assessments.q0: AnetaBTC is developing a fully on-chain wrapped BTC protocol with no third party custodian on Ergo and Cardano. This is an essential component of DeFi on a smart contract platform and will hugely increase TVL in DeFi dApps. The Rosen bridge linking Cardano and Ergo is soon to be launched, and projects like anetaBTC will help bring the two communities together. Smart contract risk is identified as a key threat, however, the NETA community fund helps to offset this risk. They haven't received any funding from VCs and there has been no ICO. As far as I know the only funding they have received is from NFT sells, their stake pool on Cardano and, I expect, market sells of the token. There have been many generous airdrops to the community with a effort at wide distribution. All of these things make this a great community project. As a user of DeFi on Ergo and Cardano, I hope this proposal gets funded.
f6_assessments.q1: The teams seems solid. They have proven to be competent with the successful launch of their Aneta Angels NFTs on Cardano and Ergo. They also set a record on Ergo airdropping their token to the most addresses in one transaction. They are advised by Kyber Network which is encouraging. However, this is the first project from the team and it's still early in their roadmap to fully gauge their competence.
f6_assessments.q2: A detailed roadmap is provided, which already shows the successful completion of many milestones. This clear roadmap will allow the project to be easily audited. There is a clear budget breakdown. Audit costs aren't mentioned in the budget, so it would be unsurprising if there was a future request for more funds. There is some overlap in the budget with anetaBTC's other Catalyst proposal. Do core team members have expenses of $10k per month because they are working on two project? It seems like this proposal will pay them twice. Same with developers and cross chain address mechanism.

f6_assessments.q0:
Bitcoin and Cardano networks share a very fundamental aspect, transfers use UXTO's as opposed to Ethereum's accounting model. In other words, spending coins in Bitcoin and Cardano is very similar to how you spend cash from your wallet and in Ethereum is how you spend money from your bank account.

This shared aspect makes it easier for bitcoin owners to use cardano because they would find it somehow familiar to what they are used to in bitcoin.

Unlike other bridging proposals this proposal focuses only on bitcoin and the roadmap is geared towards making this work decentralized, secure and reliable. I find this to be a very good approach because it focuses the team and makes it more likely that the project will be a success.

One aspect I don't really agree with is that they state that the budget will allow them to continue development for 5 months, the time needed to launch this on Ergo mainnet. This is a Cardano Catalyst proposal. I expected that the focus would be Cardano. I do understand that Ergo and Cardano are very similar and basically porting from Ergo to Cardano should be straight forward but still I think it will be fair to use Catalyst funds to develop first in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
Having worked already on 2 bridges between different blockchains I've spent a lot of time thinking and implementing most of the technical aspects that this project requires.

The proposed BTC-relay solution is a battle tested solution that is used in a bunch of other bridges out there (Keep, Celer, TokenBridge ...). The main idea is that deposits in Bitcoin are observed and payment proofs are sent to a side chain, from there anetaBTC is minted and transferred over to the receiving address in Cardano.

The team has a roadmap that shows progress done and the detailed plan until 2023. The roadmap is a little confusing because it contains references to another project that the team is working on, tosiDrop that helps them distribute the tokens that are rewarded to the LISO participants. I would have prefered to see only the roadmap for anetaBTC here.

The salaries paid for development and research are 5k a month, they don't specify how many team members are in the development or research team and if they work on this full time or not.

One other important aspect is the security of the collateralized vault, some of these vaults might contain significant amounts of BTC and they will become honeypots, the team is aware of potential risks and they are taking steps to insure funds.

At last the fact that they focus only on bridging BTC helps alot with the feasibility of this project and makes it a lot more likely to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The project has an active twitter account, discord channel where they post regular updates (at least once a week) and also their blog has relevant articles.

Their github account is not very active, at the time of writing it seems that the wallet app receives the most updates and it has been updated 12 days ago. The rest of the repos don't seem very active.

Their roadmap is clear and up-to-date and was also posted in March on their blog https://medium.com/@anetaBTC/roadmap-2-0-b2fe0c47eec6

f6_assessments.q0:
NETA project is an already established project team that has launched less than a year ago. They have issued a white paper that describes the goal of building a sustainable and robust bridge between BTC-ADA and BTC/ERG. 
The goal of the team consisting of MIT and other prestigious universities to build a smart contract system that manages this bridge efficiently. 
This challenge is seeking proposals that can help enhance the cross chain ecosystem with cardano. 
BTC being the top market cap in crypto and setting up the bridge between cardano and BTC will be essential to help divert funds without the need for centralized exchanges or other insecure methods (proxies). 
In addition the further Proof of work environment that cardano Brings might be a catalyst for explosive growth that will require a working bridge structure to support this growth. 
Neta bridge will definitely allow legacy BTC holders an easy cross chain experience once implemented.
f6_assessments.q1:
As stated in the previous proposal that Neta submitted, a total of 3. Neta is working on an ambitious work plan detailed over several years. 
The team is extremely knowledgeable and have successfully achieved many of the milestones so far successfully. Their communication and community growth has been exceptional. 
Looking into the details of this proposal NETA is requesting funding for 5 month of runrate for their current plan. 
The details of the milestones and achievements are well described and relate to concrete deliverables. 
Finally the team and their progress are well communicated and reachable on various platforms (Twitter discord etc…)
f6_assessments.q2:
Neta project and their team are all well connected and have shown productive progress over the time of their ongoing project building. The growth of their followers/supporters in various ways was successful (airdrop, NFT, LiSO etc…). Throughout the progress the team released reports updates and performance tests on various channels. 
All the funds requested will go directly to développer manhours and relate directly to building the cross chain bridge and other related deliverables (wallet, DAO etc…). 
My concern is that NETA has requested community support through their LISO and shifted some of the staking reward of their SPO by implementing a high commission to ensure covering the developers fees. I wonder if the fund is accepted how would that reflect to the community supporters. And how can we ensure the team isn’t funded in duplication.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge by releasing a token both on Cardano and ERGO. This protocol wraps bitcoin inside Cardano and erg and wants to continue development. Successful development of this project would fit with the requirements of this challenge. This proposal clearly lays out what the funds will be allocated to paying developers to continue building the projects roadmap. They have demonstrated that they have been able to integrate with both Cardano and ERG blockchains.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has been successful in the past with this project and is likely to continue to have success. The proposal mentions one of the risks of this project would be not to have enough funds to continue development without Catalyst funds. This is somewhat worrying considering the amount of adoption this token previously enjoyed. Overall the plan is detailed and includes a lot of important information about further innovations to be completed.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe the information in this proposal is not sufficient to audit this project. The audibility section refers readers to its website for its roadmap. The project does not clearly define what success looks like, leaving a vague description about becoming the most adopted. The budget states that the team will hire developers but gives no scheduled hours that will be worked. It would be difficult to know what the funds were actually used for.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that this proposal addresses the challenge. In Cardano we are focused on scalability and interoperability. Currently, Ergo is one of the biggest projects that is associated with Cardano. The AnetaBTC team is doing a great job at bringing the two projects together. There needs to be a greater understanding on how these two projects can work together to help bring scalability to each project. This proposal discusses the different use-cases on how the requested funds will help the community to understand cross-chain collaboration between Cardano and Ergo. I find this to be a great idea and that the team will be able to fulfil their promise if granted the requested funds. For this reason, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The AnetaBTC team has many great skills. They are well-known and many people in the early Cardano ecosystem are familiar with AnetaBTC and Tosidrop. The team and their combined experience have demonstrated how they put the community first, and it has led them to be very successful. They have also been one of the biggest projects that promotes cross-chain collaboration. Especially between Cardano and Ergo. I see that it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully based on what the team has already accomplished and what they plan to accomplish with the requested funds. The team is trustworthy by example, and this proposal demonstrates how they plan to accomplish this. For these reasons, I give this section of the proposal 5 stars!
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of holding the team accountable for this proposal. They are doing a great job. There is already a huge community behind the project and they will likely help the team to stay accountable and make sure that this proposal will be executed properly. The team has shown through their example that they always accomplish what they set out to do. And if they don't, they have been open with the community about it. They have a detailed roadmap that shows everything that the project has accomplished so far, and what they plan to accomplish in the future. They see that by 2023, Bitcoin holders will be able to participate in the Cardano and Ergo ecosystem by supporting their project. They have a descriptive budget breakdown that shows where all the potential funds will go. This helps ensure that the project will allocate those funds to the right places and that community members know what to expect from the team. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer explains very well how AnetaBTC works even by attaching a video so that those who read it can know it well and completely. The problems encountered are described with solutions that address the challenges using the cardano and ergo blockchains. Risks that may arise during development, such as funding and technical issues, where funding is a problem by working with the community and not from VCs so that it is truly decentralized, as well as technical ones by collaborating with similar projects from other platforms to make things better and more secure. This proposal is the same proposal in Dapps, Products & Integrations categories, https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/421701.
f6_assessments.q1: Project work has been carried out since Q4 2021 which is clearly visible in the timeline and continues to this day. In the timeline, there is a lot of additional work by creating cardano and ergo-based tokens, even making SPOs and forming communities so that they can help fund projects. The team working according to the given url looks experienced with their task, but it would be better if it was supplemented by their linkedin or github so it would be more convincing. With an experienced team, of course, you will need the appropriate funds so that the project can run well and can be completed according to the planned time. The requested funds are very reasonable with the products and services produced to achieve the main objectives of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: There is clarity in explaining the problem, solution and how the proposal is adapted to make it easier to explain. The roadmap is described in the medium url and gives details about the process the project is being worked on. The clarity of the problems and solutions provided will certainly make the metrics and KPIs that are made the right indicators for conducting evaluations. Some of the urls given are more convincing for this proposal and the social media like twitter is active to keep the project work progressing.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has been placed in the Daaps, Products & Integrations challenge.
The more interesting and useful the products and integrations are that can be built in the ecosystem the more reasons people have to interact with the Cardano blockchain that can help further drive more adoption, feedback, growth and even more innovations. AnetaBTC, the proposer is looking at the problem of BTC not being accessible on the Cardano blockchain. BTC is the highest value asset in the crypto space, and everything moves based on it's performance in current times. Having access to a wrapped version (1:1) on Cardano would have huge ramifications and bring massive value to the Cardano blockchain.

Quality Dapps, products and integrations will increase the utility & adoption of Cardano. AnetaBTC is one such Daap.

- Increasing the number of dapps and products available for the community to use that help to enrich the ecosystem with new use cases.
- Increase the number of integrations that bring existing solutions together for a more seamless and connected experience between different products.
- Increased quality of existing products & integrations through suggested improvements that is supported by customer feedback or increased usage by the community.

AnetaBTC is in alignment with all metrics of the challenge category.

This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has taken look at the risks associated with their proposal and have taken the time to work hw those risks can be mitigated. They have been working with industry leaders as well which is a huge plus for any project and proposal. I would like to quote a section of their proposal:

"
Additionally, wrapped protocols and bridges, especially on Ethereum, have a history of poor security, leading to hacks and exploits. To mitigate this risk, we are led by researchers and security engineers from the most prestigious universities and institutions around the world. Additionally, we are working closely with Kyber Network, the inventors and developers of wBTC and KyberSwap. WrappedBTC and KyberSwap, are widely considered the more innovate platforms on Ethereum. To this day, neither of these platforms has experienced a hack or exploit.
"

This is key information and shows that AnetaBTC is working with the best they can find to circumvent any risks that could come about and create a truly secure platform.

Moving on to the timeline we see in this proposal and incredibly well laid out roadmap/timeline/plan with milestones and time horizons. Further more they have marked what has already been completed and what is left, and the plan set forth is reasonable and achievable, and testnet planned for Q3.

Looking at the budget section of this proposal they already have an idea of costs per month based on the work that has been done since the end of 2021. They have laid out what is needed and it is reasonable to achieve the goals which is to allow them to continue development for at least 5 more months, which we believe is ample time to launch our protocol on Ergo mainnet. They have also taken into consideration as to whether or not they may need additionally funding in the future. They have targeted the area around auditing the code as a possibility for additional funds which would be reasonable considering the nature of this project.

Finally we have the team. The team is not listed in the proposal but gives a direct link to the full team to review who they are, and image of each person, and what their experience and skills are. The team is composed of of PhD researchers and developers from MIT and University of Finland. The team is also advised Kyber Network, the inventors and lead developers of Wrapped BTC on Ethereum, the #1 wrapped Bitcoin product in the world. This is an all-star team to say the least.

I strongly agree that given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team is using their roadmap to determine how well the project is progressing and how successful they have been. They give us a link to the complete roadmap, and as mentioned earlier, this roadmap is complete, clear, well detailed, and those things which have already been completed are marked as such. This gives us a complete picture in which to track the progress and success of this proposal.

The proposer has laid out what the success of the project looks like in a clear, definable way, and has a discord, twitter, and other platforms that they use to keep the community informed on the progress and success of this Bitcoin wrapping protocol.

I strongly agree that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

solution: anetaBTC is a decentralized, fully on-chain, wrapped BTC product that allows users to seamlessly unlock their BTC value on Cardano and Ergo.
experience: anetaBTC is composed of a team of PhD researchers and developers from MIT and University of Finland. The team is also advised Kyber Network, the inventors and lead developers of Wrapped BTC on Ethereum, the #1 wrapped Bitcoin product in the world.
